intro: Doryopteris quinquelobata var. septemlobata, commonly known as the seven-lobed water fern, is a variant of the five-lobed water fern native to tropical regions. It is a member of the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, finely divided, pinnate fronds. The fronds are typically light green and have a delicate, feathery appearance, making it a striking ornamental plant. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found near streams or in humid forests. This variant is noted for its unique lobing pattern, which distinguishes it from other members of the species.
